content.raw:
@iche033 changing the file to Dockerfile without the -f worked. Taking out the MASTER_URI was also necessary.  

My software ran and generated a little bit of log output which I saw using SSH. But then docker itself quit which, of course, dropped the SSH. The simulation was running. The little I saw showed my code got into ROS activity. Is there any way to see more after Docker is gone? Is it possible in this setup to connect a Docker directory to an external directory to preserve that log?
content.html:
@iche033 changing the file to Dockerfile without the -f worked. Taking out the MASTER_URI was also necessary.

My software ran and generated a little bit of log output which I saw using SSH. But then docker itself quit which, of course, dropped the SSH. The simulation was running. The little I saw showed my code got into ROS activity. Is there any way to see more after Docker is gone? Is it possible in this setup to connect a Docker directory to an external directory to preserve that log?
